title: Zoe Saldana and her husband Marco Perego attend the National Arts Awards
text:
It seems as though Zoe Saldana and Marco Perego took their date night to the National Arts Awards.

The stunning couple posed together as they attended the event held in New York on Monday evening.

Both Zoe, 41, and Marco, 40 both smiled as they dressed up for the Americans for the Arts event on Monday.

Date night: Zoe Saldana and Marco Perego took their date night to the National Arts Awards on Monday evening

The Avatar actress looked stunning in a longsleeve black gown and statement green earrings.

Her dress had some ruffle detailing along the sleeves and the neckline leaving the skirt simple.

She wore her hair back to show off the drop of color hanging from her ears as she gave a big smile while out with her film director husband.

Stunning: The Avatar actress looked stunning in a longsleeve black gown and statement green earrings

Details: She wore her hair back to show off the drop of color hanging from her ears as she gave a big smile while out with her film director husband

Marco looked dashing in a black suit. He left one button undone as he posed next to his wife while donning a pair of sleek black shoes.

The two got married back in London in 2014 in a small romantic ceremony.

Saldana was previously linked to Bradley Cooper in 2011 to 2013 but seems to have found her true love with Marco.

Friends: Zoe and Ben Platt smile together at the event before heading inside for some cocktails

The actress has been extremely busy lately gearing up for the long-awaited Avatar sequel.

While it's been nearly 10 years since the first film came out, the second one has an anticipated release date of December 2021.

But James Cameron says there is more on the way than just the one sequel.

Group photo: Ben Platt, Zoe, and Ben Folds all smile together at the even held on 42nd street in New York

He has geared up for not one, but four Avatar movies that are slated for release all the way to 2025.

'I've been working the last couple years with four top screenwriters and with some of the top artisan designers in the world to design the world of Avatar going forward—to design the characters, the creatures, the environment, the new cultures,' film-maker James Cameron told Vanity Fair back in 2016.

'Everything it takes to bring that world to life. So far, what I'm seeing—the art I'm seeing on the walls. . . the stuff that has been developed is, in pure imagination, is really far beyond the first film. The people who have seen it so far have been speechless.'
